greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strong complete mappings of the cyclic group Z_{2n+1}.
comment: A strong complete mapping of a cyclic group (Z_n,+) is a permutation f(x) of Z_n such that f(0)=0 and that f(x)-x and f(x)+x are both permutations.
a(n) is the number of solutions of the toroidal n-queen problem (A007705) with 2n+1 queens and one queen in the top-left corner.
reference: Anthony B. Evans,"Orthomorphism Graphs of Groups", vol. 1535 of Lecture Notes in Mathematics, Springer-Verlag, 1991.
Y. P. Shieh, J. Hsiang and D. F. Hsu, "On the enumeration of Abelian k-complete mappings", vol. 144 of Congressus Numerantium, 2000, pp. 67-88.
link: Jieh Hsiang, Yuh Pyng Shieh, and Yao Chiang Chen, Cyclic complete mappings counting problems
D. Novakovic, Computation of the number of complete mappings for permutations Cybernetics & System Analysis, No. 2, v. 36 (2000), pp. 244-247.
I. Rivin, I. Vardi and P. Zimmermann, The n-queens problem, Amer. Math. Monthly, 101 (1994), pp. 629-639.
example: f(x)=2x in (Z_7,+) is a strong complete mapping of Z_7 since f(0)=0 and both f(x)-x (=x) and f(x)+x (=3x) are permutations of Z_7.
results.author: J. Hsiang, D. F. Hsu and Y. P. Shieh (arping(AT)turing.csie.ntu.edu.tw), Jun 03 2002
ext: a(15)-a(16) added using A007705 by _Andrew Howroyd_, May 07 2021
